english_translation: Narrated from Ali: When a man and woman have intercourse while both are in a state of Iḥrām, they must separate until they complete their rituals, and the obligation for the Ḥajj returns upon them next year. They shall not reach that place where the transgression occurred except while in a state of Iḥrām. When they reach it, they must separate until they complete their rituals, and each of them must offer a sacrificial animal. And Zaid ibn Ali said: Whoever completed all the rituals except the circumambulation, then had intercourse with his family, his Ḥajj is nullified, and the obligation for Ḥajj returns upon him next year, and he must offer a sacrificial animal for what he nullified in his Ḥajj. And Zaid ibn Ali said regarding the muḥrim kissing his wife: He must offer a sacrificial animal - a sheep. If he has an emission, then he owes the like of that, and his Ḥajj is complete.

english_translation: Narrated from Ali: Whoever's back is ailing, let him ride his sacrificial animal in a lawful manner. And the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saw men walking, so he ordered them to ride their sacrificial animals, saying: You are not riding a Sunnah more guided than the Sunnah of your Prophet ﷺ.

english_translation: Narrated from Ali: That when he would slaughter his sacrificial animal, he would face the Qiblah, then say: I have directed my face towards the One who created the heavens and the earth, as a Hanif and Muslim, and I am not from those who ascribe partners to Allah. Indeed, my prayer, my sacrifice, my life and my death are for Allah, Lord of the worlds, with no partner for Him. With this I have been commanded, and I am from those who submit. In the name of Allah, Allah is greatest. O Allah, from You and to You. O Allah, accept from Ali. And he disliked piercing the animals until they died. And he would give one-third, eat one-third, and set aside one-third.

english_translation: Narrated from Ali: The days of slaughter are three days: the tenth day of Dhu al-Hijjah and two days after it. On whichever of them you slaughter, it will suffice you. And the months of Hajj are what Allah said: "The Hajj is in the well-known months" - Shawwal, Dhu al-Qi'dah, and ten days of Dhu al-Hijjah. The well-known days are the days of the ten, and the enumerated days are the days of Tashriq. So whoever hastens in two days and departs after the day of slaughter by two days, there is no sin upon him. And whoever delays, there is no sin upon him.

english_translation: Narrated from Ali: That he said regarding the sacrifice: Sound in both eyes and ears, and the legs must be intact - not marked, not pierced, not defective in the front, nor in the back. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ commanded us to examine the eye and ear, taking a two-toothed goat or a yearling sheep if it is fat, not pierced, nor cut, nor infirm, nor having any defect. If something befalls it after you purchase it, when it reaches the place of slaughter there is no harm. Abu Khalid said: Zaid ibn Ali explained to us the front-cutting: when the tip of the ear is cut. The back-cutting: when the side of the ear is cut. The marking: the branded one. The piercing: the one whose ear is pierced.
